page.title: 01Caldicot
page.content: {Caldicot}is one of the parishes of the {Monmouth District}and is situated in the South East corner of {Gwent}mid way between the towns of{Chepstow}and {Newport.}Thirty years ago it was just a village but with the building of {Llanwern}Steelworks it has grown into quite a large town. It is crossed by the M4, by the main South Wales to the Midlands rail routes and by the main South Wales to London railway which enters the western approach of the{Severn Tunnel. The main part of Caldicot lies between the Railway and the M4. To the South is the estuary of the{River {Severn}surrounded by low pasturelands. Caldicot is bound on the West side by{ {Rogiet}and quite a large area of woodland. { }
